Reviews.Title: “Worth considering ... at least”
Reviews.Author: Lara369
Reviews.Content: Very central - no need to catch any public transoport it ultimately saves both time and money Clean room and comfortable beds Good breakfast good selection of breads jam hams teas coffe and juices etc. Friendly staff both at reception and breakfast area lift out of order but receptionist offered to take our luggage up the narrow steap stairs. Would not recommend this hotel to peope using wheelchairs and have trouble with mobility. People who want to come to amsterdam but want to stay away from the Red Light District as this hotel is right in the middle.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: paul p
Reviews.Content: We also stayed in the hotel last month. I must say that we really enjoyed it. Only the breakfast is not the best we ever had but thats really the only down point I can think off. The staff was friendly and very helpfull. Especially Imre (receptionist) was very nice to us and gave us good tips about the hot spots in the city. I did smoked a joint for the first time and got a bit of a bad trip but Imre calmed me and my girlfriend down and helped me getting back up on my feet. I am really thankfull for your help Imre. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and if we go to Amsterdam again for sure we will book a room at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: louise c Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, nice room and excellent location. Staff are very friendly and helpfully would def stay again!

Reviews.Title: “basic,does the job!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: breakfast wasnt very nice, selection of cold and hot beverages which was good but food not apetising at all,

Reviews.Title: “absolutely faboulous”
Reviews.Author: anthony b Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we had a large group of lads , 15 to be exact , 3 rooms booked , 2 in the koopermoolen and one elsewhere, there were 3 lads in the hotel itself and 6 of us in the apartment next door too the hotel . i have to say the location was perfect for what we were after , very close to everything . the staff in the koopermoolen were as helpful as could be and the breakfast was very nice , i would highly recommend this hotel to people looking to have a great weekend in amsterdam , i didnt rate the sleep quality very high , but then again who wants too sleep in amsterdam , theres way too much to do at any time of the day , great city and we will definetely return in 2012

Reviews.Title: “One night in Koopermoolen”
Reviews.Author: Vitalii S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rather good for rather cheap hotel. Few steps from Central station. Few steps from main sights. A lot of cafes and restorations around. Rather clean but a bit shabby rooms. A central heating knocked all night long but it is not a problem for those who really want to sleep :).

Reviews.Title: “Good location and space in apartment for groups”
Reviews.Author: kchallis15
Reviews.Content: A group of 5 of us stayed at the Hotel De Koopermoolen. Location was brilliant and less than a 5 minute walk from the station. Upon arrival we were allocated the apartment ( which sleeps up to 6) which is located in its own outhouse 2 doors down from the hotel. WARNING - The stairs to the apartment are very steep, so either don't take a lot of luggage or make sure there's someone big and strong to carry it up for you. The apartment is very spacious with the kitchen, bathroom and lounge (with TV) on the first floor and 2 bedrooms - each with 3 single beds - on the second floor. All clean and basic, no reason to complain. overall great location, good value for money, clean and spacious. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Marburg an der Lahn, Hessen, Germany
Reviews.Title: “Nice, little Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Joschka P
Reviews.Content: The Rooms were clean and comfortable, staff was very nice and breakfast was good. Just 5 minutes from Amsterdam Centraal, within walking distance from all important Attractions. Almost in the middle of the RedLight District, but not too loud. Even an elevator was available - very rare in Amsterdam. We will definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Liam1019
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a weekend stay in amsterdam, was brilliant! Stayed in the apartment which is seprate to the hotel, like having your own place, stayed with 5 mates, it couldn't have been in a better spot, people on reception were very friendly and helpful, the apartment it's self was great, clean and tidy, maybe a little out dated but what are you expecting for a 2 star? Little bit noisy at night but if your coming back late yourself then it's fine! Will be returning in the future, wouldn't stay anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “AwwDAM this place was Great!”
Reviews.Author: SolidApparel
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay on a budget! In the heart of the action and close to it all! Clean rooms and amazing staff! Thomas was awesome!!! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Last Night of the Trip”
Reviews.Author: Abigail W
Reviews.Content: Partner of a different hotel (Hotel Prins Hendrik) whose owner helped carry our bags to De Koopermoolen since they didn't have room there. Very accommodating, and on short notice. We were already in the city, searching for a place to stay that night, for only one night-November 26, 2011. It was fairly cheap, considering the awesome location. Right in the middle of the city, and about a two minute walk to Amsterdam Centraal Station. I can't say we were happy with the cleanliness of our room, but it could've been worse. No safe in the room, but there was a place downstairs where you could lock up valuables. The room did also come with breakfast tickets, though we had to check out too early to be able to use them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Anny56
Reviews.Content: Five friends and I stayed at the Koopermoolen in Nov 2011. Hotel is in an excellent location 1 minute walk from the station and in walking distance of all the main attractions. We stayed in the self contained apartment which is seperate from the main hotel this was perfect for us although its not exactly modern everything was clean and did the job! Only bad point is the steep stairs however this is Amsterdam and they arnt doing exactly doing you any harm!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Reviews.Title: “An expensive disapointment”
Reviews.Author: GOC_RJ
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on a last-minute trip. Location was perfect and staff was nice - these are the only positive aspects of my stay in this hotel. I've booked a single room, and got a terrible - extremely tiny, with dirty mattresses - attic room. I could not believe that such room was even allowed by Dutch health and safety regulations - it had a tiny window, if you opened the bathroom door you blocked the way out, it was terribly lit, had no ventilation at all, a very, very old TV, only one power outlet. The elevator would not go to my floor (fifth floor) - I had to climb a set of very narrow stairs with heavy luggage. That room should be used as a storage! And they do need one, as the spare beds were literally everywhere in the corridors. Staying close to the train station is convenient, but a bit overrated - Amsterdam is a very compact city and there are better - and cheaper - options just outside of the old city centre. On a next visit will look for alternatives elsewhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will certainly be returning”
Reviews.Author: Salvati_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with two teenage sons for one night on a ferry break. The location was ideal, being 5 minutes walk from the P&O bus drop off and pick up point. The hotel staff were all very helpful and courteous. Offered trip advice, places to see and best place to change currency. The hotel is on a busy road, but we asked for a quiet room and were given one. It was spotlessly clean and much bigger than I expected. With big shower cubicle , air con and a TV. There is also a lift, for people less able to manage the stairs. Another really good thing is an ample buffet breakfast is included. Saves having to find somewhere reasonable to eat. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: Ric56
Reviews.Content: For a 2 star it was a nice place,the room and bedding were clean.It was a small room but overlooked the street. we were hardly there.Free breakfast too.Easy walk to anywhere including the CS was a 5 minute walk.The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent localization,great service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Silviane5
Reviews.Content: I arrived a little before the sunrise, a time unfit for checking in, and without reserve in the middle week of the Queen's Day, but I was very well attended. Acceptable price for clean room, hot shower and a great breakfast. In addition to free internet and best of all, very well located. The service was excellent, the receptionist gave me tips all the city's tourism, and all hotel employees were very kind. Certainly when I return to Amsterdam, i don' t have to worry about a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Central, comfortable, couldnt ask for more”
Reviews.Author: BL1P1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend during May this year. The Hotel is a short walk from Central station and within a stones throw of the 'local entertainment'. Our room appeared to have been refurbed recently. It was very clean, spacious and very quiet. Sleep quality was fantastic. To be honest, we didnt spend much time at the hotel. However, from what i experienced of the hotel i cannot really fault it. Very good value for money and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Central basic hotel, defiently would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: hannah258
Reviews.Content: Staff were really friendly and helpful. Felt really safe in the hotel and the location was amazing, right in the middle of everything! Would defiently recommend. Don't expect 5 star accommodation just a great value basic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic time and will return!”
Reviews.Author: triximarie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a short break on our honeymoon. The staff were lovely, welcoming and friendly. We were upgraded to the loft suite with the fancy bath free of charge which we thought was a nice touch. If you have high expectations of a hotel with pampering and relaxation then this isn't the place for you. However, if you're after somewhere central to everything and somewhere to get your head down then I would suggest this place. We did suffer from the heat being at the top and it being rather warm outside but they provided a fan which helped keep us cool. We were recommended this hotel by some family that had stayed here previously and do plan to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but a bit over priced”
Reviews.Author: ChrisfromTO
Reviews.Content: My wife booked this hotel for our first two nights in Holland. She chose it mostly for its location and proximity to Central Station. The hotel is very convenient to walk to all attractions in the city; nothing was more than a Â½ hour walk. When we arrived the desk clerk was very helpful and cheery. Our room was on the fourth floor and was part of the attic space. We were in Holland during a very warm spring and with no ac in the hotel, the room was very warm. Fortunately the windows opened and we both use earplugs. The beds were small low singles with a thin lumpy mattress, I slept not too bad but my wife complained about her back in the morning. The washroom is poorly equipped, there are no hooks or shelves to put anything on or store your towels. When you have a shower you have to just leave the towel on the floor or across the room in the sink. The toilet is what I can best describe as a shelf style that if you havenâ€™t seen one of these old styles before will definitely encourage you to finish quickly or flush and hope for no splash back. It must have been the first design improvement to the Asian squat toilet. Basically a flushing outhouse. The hotel advertized free wireless internet but the system didnâ€™t work. I inquired at the desk and was told that it was new and didnâ€™t work yet, that was why it was free. When they get it operational they are going to charge for it. So remember it is only free because it doesnâ€™t work. They did have a computer in the lobby that you can use for now if you can get some time on it. That is also not going to be provided for free in the future. My wife needed to make a call to her cousin so we could meet him for dinner one night and found out that you cannot make outside calls anywhere in the hotel. If you are like us and donâ€™t have a mobile or donâ€™t want to pay exorbitant roaming charges, you have very limited options. There are some but not many pay phones in the city (we only found two that werenâ€™t broken), but they only work with what is called a chip card (basically a prepaid phone card). There are no retailer of these cards anywhere in the vicinity of the phones and the only retailer we found was at central station a Â½ hour walk away. There is however no phones in central station so we had to walk Â½ hour walk back to the phone near dam square. A continental breakfast is provided and is above par. Lots of different breads, cheeses, meats, cereals, fresh fruits, juices and hard boiled eggs. You can make a hearty enough breakfast to last you till dinner. I am sure some of the younger guests were making sandwiches to take with them. A sign asks you not to take the food out but many had sandwich bags that they put their lunches in. All in all our stay at the Koopermoolens hotel was acceptable, but at 130 Euro a night it was overpriced. During our stay the hotel was booked up so we might have been paying a premium. I would think the hotel realistically was worth more in the 80 to 100 Euro a night range in busy season and much less in the off season.

Reviews.Title: “Location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: SydneyBill
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and will be happy to stay there again in the future. While some previous complaints about the rooms being a bit tired have some merit I liked the breakfast and the staff were helpful. Not recommended for light sleepers but the location near Central Station and major tourist attractions was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Needed a last minute bed for the night - served its purpose!”
Reviews.Author: LukewarmCatastrophe
Reviews.Content: As the title of my review implies, we had not booked this hotel in advance. We had been to a concert and planned to wander the streets/do a spot of midnight sight-seeing/have a nap in Central Station if need be before catching an early train to Germany the following day. However, it got to 2.30am and our feet were killing us, Central Station was closed and we just wanted somewhere to lie down. After knocking on various doors and being quoted ridiculous prices, we visited the sister hotel of the Koopermoolen (I can't remember what it was called!) and they couldn't help, but the night manager was kind enough to put us in touch with this hotel. We bartered down to a very cheap rate of Â£56 for a room (amazing value for something this central at short notice) and checked in. The guy on reception was very nice. He had a tattoo on his neck and was very funny. He was having to deal with some crazy "regular" who was after a bed for the night also - this guy was bare chested, sweating and had a Cockney accent - if we weren't so knackered we'd have been mortified at what we were potentially letting ourselves in for, but were too tired to care and the receptionist really was a comedian! He ended up giving us a triple room as that was all that was left which made the Â£56 price even more appealing. The room was really hot, even with the windows open, but hey, it's July in Amsterdam, what do you expect? Our train out of the Dam was in 3 hours time and we just wanted a disco nap so we didn't care. There were a few dubious stains on the top sheets (because of the heat, we didn't bother to actually LIFT the top sheets, the actual bedsheets may have been pristine underneath, I guess we'll never know!) but we just laid out our towels (which were clean, hoorah!) and fell asleep on top of them. The room had it's own shower and toilet (so rare to find this in a hotel of this price category in central amsterdam!) which seemed to be in good condition and working order, although we didn't use the shower due to lack of time. Yeah, there was a fair bit of noise from the street below but again, what do you expect? We were so tired, we got the 3 hours sleep we wanted in a safe, comfortable room that was a stones throw from Central Station and was two thirds cheaper than the price of what all the other hotels were asking. Also, breakfast was included in the rate - again, such a rarity! It was quite cute as the receptionist had asked us if we required a wake-up call before we went to bed the night before and when we came down into reception at 6.15am, he was fast asleep in his chair! He raced downstairs to put the lights on in the breakfast room and left us to help ourselves after grabbing a few essentials out of the fridge (milk and some fruit etc) Everything else - the cereal, the breads had presumably been left there all night and for God knows how many days before that, so we reluctantly ate the "safe" stuff and didn't touch any of the cold meats/cheese although in fairness, it all looked very nice and contrary to what other reviewers have said, there seemed to be a fair bit of choice. To summarise, this hotel does exactly what it says on the tin. It gives you 2 star standards in a great location. I observed the price list in reception and the rack rate for our room was allegedly over 200 Euros and to be honest, you'd be a fool to pay that although I'm sure less seasoned travellers than myself would fall for it but places like this are happy to let you barter - I mean, we wandered in at 2.30am, who else was gonna sleep in that room and spend Â£56? Certainly not the crazy Cockney! I would stay again if I was in the same predicament, but I very much doubt I ever will be although I'd definitely pop by the Koopermoolen again just to say hi to the owner for being such a good entertainer and a thoroughly nice bloke for saving 2 young ladies from a night of horror on the streets of Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Typical Amsterdam 2 star.......dark, dingy & dreary.”
Reviews.Author: Irishlass138
Reviews.Content: On business trip for 2 nights so thought 2 star might do.............no! Hotel was tiny & room had no window, lighting was so dim....I think it was so that you couldn't get a good look at how dreary & tired everything was.Shower door handle was broken so you couldn't get into it..lucky colleague was tall & could open for me from top. Breakfast is a joke! Choice of 2 cereals, a piece of fruit, a cup of coffee or tea & if your really really lucky you might be on time to get a luke warm boiled egg....but forget about toast! I have read on trip advisor that toaster broke about 2008 .........well they didn't buy another one! On good side-location is brill, welcome was friendly & bed linen was crisp n clean.

Reviews.Title: “very central,CHEAP AND CHEERFUL”
Reviews.Author: sonofquagmireGlasgow
Reviews.Content: good location 2mins central station, dam square red light. hotel clean .basic conti b/fast a toaster wood be nice stayed in the suite top floor nice and quiet also wide screen tv and jacuzzi. stayed in amsterdam many times but first time at this hotel as good as any good 3* hotel in the dam plus you could smoke,happy days, lots of coffee shops on this street

Reviews.Title: “excellent location for Dam fun!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mushymayhem
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Koopermoolen about half a dozen times now and can honestly say weve never had a bad experience yet(touch wood)!The hotel has everything you need for a fab stay in Dam,close to all the major sights and only a stones throw from Central Station,the staff have always been very helpful and a good laugh too!Can seem a bit pricey but what do people expect from a hotel in the centre of a major city.My only complaint(albeit only a small one)is that the breakfasts could be better.So all in all we find the Koopermoolen to be a great base from which to discover Amsterdam.HAVE FUN!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not so cheap and not so cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: flyingscorpio
Reviews.Content: Checked thro some reviews before we booked this hotel and saw that it had recently been renovated - but think it needs a good overhaul. There were various glitches - hardryer was faulty and the wardrobe door was falling off and the bedding was torn - not what we expected with the prices charged. We had a room at the front of the hotel, which looked out on to a very noisy street with a takeaway directly opposite. Shouting seemed to go on for most of the night. Having said this,staff were all very friendly and helpful and the hotel is within easy reach of Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “It's not The Ritz but it does the job.”
Reviews.Author: GizmoCairo
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early, not really expecting to be able to get into the room. We were not disappointed. The luggage room was down a very narrow corridor, it was small and cramped (but then we discovered this was typical of many things in Amsterdam) and difficult to move around in. However, it was secure and did the job. Check in and out were smooth and the staff were very helpful. One person and 2 suitcases (just) fit into the lift which almost stopped on the floor of the suite which we had booked. Climbing into the suite was like going up a bunkbed ladder and required significant physical effort to manoeuvre our luggage up there. The bottom of the stairs was next to the door to the lift machinery room which was inside the suite and noises from within could be heard during the night, along with the slamming of the lift door. As it's also well placed on a busy street, don't bother staying if you want peace and quiet. It didn't disrupt our sleep after a busy day walking. The room itself was interesting. The bed was a contiboard construction, fine for sleeping but was very uncomfortable for laying on and watching the portable TV or reading. It was also quite high and the edges of the boards made it a bruising experience. The jacuzzi, in the middle of the room (almost) with a shower head protuding through the ceiling above it, made bathing a public experience as there was no dividing curtain or screen (neither were there any blinds or curtains on the frosted windows that overlooked the street from the bath area). Thankfully, there was a separate toilet and sink. The wardrobe was tiny and we just managed to store our 5 days worth of clothing. The carpet between the bedroom and toilet was badly worn and looked shabby, other fixtures and fittings were in a reasonable state of repair and YES the jacuzzi did work. Breakfast was good, a European/Continental selection of cold meats, cheese, cereals, juice etc. The wireless internet was there but the staff did not have usernames and passwords so it was unusable. There is, however, a computer in the lobby area with internet connection for free use. Despite what may seem to be negative comments, we were happy with our stay and would recommend it for those people who are able bodied and do not intend to spend much time in the room. The location is great for central station, Dam Square and the Red Light District all within very easy walking distance. If you are travelling light make sure you take the train from Schipol, it gets there in half the time and at less than half of the cost of other methods of airport transfer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: blahblahblahblah21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really close to everything. Redlight district is about 2 or 3 streets behind you and Dam square is 1 street infront. All of the staff were extremely helpful, one receptionist took the time to find a reason why Sudafed isn't sold in Holland and another entertained us by letting us listen to his muppets impressions (On mp3...he's great!! The room was small but extremely clean and perfect for what we needed. Shower was always clean and there was always hot water. The breakfast was a typical continental breakfast. I would most certainly stay there again and I am planning to visit Amsterdam in Oct 2009!

Reviews.Title: “Not good!”
Reviews.Author: travels43
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the red light district so if you want the noise, fumes and everything else that goes with it this is your perfect hotel. The room was clean, but we moved rooms because the bedsprings were sticking through the mattress. The staff was helpfull though. Had an unfortunate incident there where something got 'lost' from our room. I contacted them and they weren't very helpfull. Wouldn't saty here again. Amsterdam has many really cool hostels to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “---> Best priced hotel!! <---”
Reviews.Author: milangelo
Reviews.Content: First off all the hotel is perfectly located in the middle of the going out area in amsterdam. Wich offcourse make's the room's a little noisey, but when you are going out untill late yourself you will not find any problems there. Secondly it is only a few minutes away from central station Great!! The hotel itself is pretty good, the room's are a little small but big enough for the price you are paying. --The room was cleaned every day.-- --The bed was really comforteble.-- --And there was a good bathroom.-- --good price-- there are very freindly and helpfull receptionist's they make you feel welcome and can tell you a lot off good place's to be. overall this is a great hotel to stay i can really recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: travelmomWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: Really excellent friendly staff who were very helpful. Very clean, quiet comfortable rooms, close to everything. Short walk from the train station. Excellent breakfast buffet in the downstairs. I arrived after having had a horrendous night of missed flight connections, and the staff were really considerate - also internet available to check messages. Great Value!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: waelfarhat
Reviews.Content: To start with the location,the hotel has an excellent location.Close to amsterdam central station (100 meters walk).It is in the middle of the action sitiuated in a street full of bars, coffee shops (where they sell mariguana and hash) resturants and sex shops.It is a 2 minutes walk from the red light district.Also it is 2 minutes walk to the Damrak and main shopping street in amsterdam. I had a single room, it was a tiny small room, but don't expect more than that in a 3 stars hotel in amsterdam.you only need it for sleeping 3 or 4 hours not more.the breakfast was ok.good value for money.My room had a window and was well ventillated.Other rooms had windows that can't be opened, and these rooms had instead , a ceiling fan for ventillation.Overall it is a good hotel for budget travellers that are having a short stay in amsterdam. Enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “In the Dark”
Reviews.Author: mammap
Reviews.Content: The room was small, but clean. There was not adequate lighting in the hall or in the room. The one window did not open and gave no light or ventilation. The location was good; breakfast was adequate; the staff were very helpful; and the price was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dan420
Reviews.Content: Nice location, a short walk from central station and easy to get to from the airport. This hotel is right in the middle of all the action you come to Amsterdam for. Coffee shops are everywhere near this hotel, and the center of the Red Light District is a 5 minute walk away. Its also very close to Dam Square. The staff was very friendly and the front desk has someone on duty 24hrs a day, and its not a problem to stumble in at 3AM and go up to your room. The rooms are a little smaller than what you'd get in the USA, but you don't exactly make the journey to Amsterdam to sit it a hotel room anyway... The room is clean, the beds are comfortable, the bathroom is clean, there is a closet, chairs, table, night stands, and they have cable TV with programing in English. There's a PC with high speed Internet in the lobby. They have free breakfast until 10AM, which was pretty good and had a decent selection of stuff to eat. Also if you have postcards you want to send home, you can leave it with the person at the front desk and they'll put it in the mail for you. All in all I "enjointed" my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Koopermoolen - comfortable, good value hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HannahUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the central station and therefore great for getting around. It is a short walk from the red light district but far enough away not to notice, if you don't want to see this part of the city. The staff are welcoming. The rooms are comfortable and good value for Amsterdam. I was told by the friendly receptionist that the hotel had recently been taken over and revamped. There is no bar in this hotel, but there are plenty just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Book Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: BILLJ_GA
Reviews.Content: I have been to many countries and stayed in many places that I have paid as little as $7 night. I have never stayed in any place as bad as this. If I knew it was safe to sleep in a park in Amsterdam I would have rather have done that. I don't see how they could legally charge 123 Euro a night. Even if you are drunk, etc you would not want to sleep here. The people who have written good reviews must know of some new drug or they are associated with this nightmare. Want to know why it is so bad: 1) Ceiling fan in the room only had three blades and they were all bent down. Oh.. it didn't work either... 2) It was very cool outside, but hot as hell inside and you could not open a window. I mean VERY hot. We would lay our clothes out so that right when you get dried off after a shower you throw your clothes on and get out before you start sweating. 3) Shower was nasty nasty. 4) TV remote did not work, and TV only worked sometimes. 5) Rooms are very, very, very small. Don't count on seeing any room like the photos on their website. The only good thing I can say is that the hotel room forces you to spend as little time as possible in the room and to spend all your time out seeing the sites. Uggggh! I hope one day I will be able to forget this scary place!

Reviews.Title: “Can't understand all the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: TomSal
Reviews.Content: Okay, I admit the hotel isn't 5 star, but if you only want a place to sleep and wash I don't think you can go wrong with this place. The location is excellent, close to central station, Dam Square, Red Light district etc. The rooms were warm and comfortable, clean and the bed nice to sleep on. Didn't try breakfast so can't comment. If you are in the dam as a group on the beer and what to be close to all the action, give it a try. No problems with reception either and didn't feel unsafe once.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awful......”
Reviews.Author: AshburtonGrove
Reviews.Content: This hotel has obviously changed ownership since I last stayed. What a difference! It used to be ok, nice lady on reception, nothing special, but ok for cheap digs and a place to crash after a day on the lash. But now its simply awful. The new owners simply don't provide any customer service (as I found out when the maid had accidentally removed my towell from the room - I never got it back.) The rooms are dimly lit, the showers poor and lack power, linen ripped and dirty, carpets sticky, broken light bulbs, toilet didn't always flush properly, and no remote for the TV. The room I most recently stayed in had windows that opened out onto what I might only describe as an empty lift shaft - this was regularly used by guests in other rooms to be sick into from their windows - not nice to be woken up like this at 3am. This should really only be used as a place to crash out when wasted, its noisy, full of drunk tourists and the reception is always smokey. Breakfast? Are they sure? I wouldn't call it breakfast - just some dodgy bread and rancid looking cheese. A very poor hotel now - pity as I have some fond memories of staying here on previous trips over many years. Good location though! But I can't think of anything else positive to say. I'd avoid it based on experience. For a few extra Euros you will find something a lot cleaner and nicer.

Reviews.Title: “The worst i ever seen”
Reviews.Author: triumphant
Reviews.Content: I would strongly recommend to any one reading theses reviews NOT to book here. In all my travels over the years to Amsterdam, this has got to be by far the worst hotel i have ever stayed in. Dirt and dusty are everywhere, the rooms are small, smelly, carpets stained and fraying at the edges, the curtains are disgusting. The bathroom was disgusting, and the glass is clear plain glass, so you have got blinds to pull for privacy, but only some !!! The room had not been cleaned since the last people checked out, there was used tissues on the floor, bedding was once white but now grey and full of holes. The mattress is as firm as a marshmallow!! The reception is as bad, stairs to rooms are filthy at best, fag ends all over, litter behind doors. We noticed that a young group of folk were also not happy with their room and were checking out, but they were getting charged for one night, even though they refused to stay. I noticed then that the staff are shocking, one guy in a suit was swearing at the young group and being very intimidating. The reception is always full of the " staffs" family and friends, and make you very nervous when you walk through, they stop talking and watch you and carry on their conversation when you are walking away. As for helpful !!!! not in the least, we were waiting for a call from the airport regarding our baggage, they did call, just reception could not be bothered passing on the message. Hit them with a problem and they will blatantly walk away, as happened to me, i stood there unable to believe that they walked away!! and carried on their conversations. We stayed the one night, only because we could not get a refund for the whole stay, checked out the next morning after being told we would be refunded for the other two nights!!! We had to fight to get our refund after being offered it a few hours previous, then told they could not refund the payment to our card as they did not know how to!! and then told we can do it, but it will take a few weeks !!!! i was not prepared for that and eventually got a refund in cash, but i think it was only because of my size and stature or the fact that i had red mist decending and was about to rip the head off the manager( george) if he is the manager ? Take it from me , dont not even consider this hotel, how any one can give this place decent review is beyond me!!

Reviews.Title: “lovely place, warm people”
Reviews.Author: bigsmile
Reviews.Content: I have had marvelous time at this hotel. It has spacious rooms and beds they are also very clean. The hotel is in the heart of amsterdam, all the famous attractions is only walking distance. Also we really liked the rich breakfast. And what I liked most was the people who works there, were extremly kind ,friendly, talkative, helpfull, cheerfull. I will go back there just to visit the hotel workers, I spend lots of time with them listening their funny stories about amsterdam. Lovely place to go. Dont expect luxury but it is a modest , clean friendly place I would say its just for young people. Go meet the fun people there...

Reviews.Title: “Good value 4 money”
Reviews.Author: MakedonskoDevojce
Reviews.Content: I read all the comments and I am thinking why people go to busy part of the town if they want to see the historic Amsterdam????????? This Hotel was clean to my standards. Clean bedding, bathroom, towels, breakfast area etc. People were smoking at the reception but who cared. The rooms are on the first floor so you could not smell the cigarette smell. People at the reception were helpful for direction, telephone, attractions, thought the lady in the kitchen was a bit funny. One day we went late for breakfast and we asked for more boiled eggs as there werenâ€™t any left at the buffet, but she didnâ€™t give us any, she said that we have to come early not at the end of the breakfast time!!!!!!!!!! The Hotel is in a very central and convenient location. Few minutes walk to the Dam Square and shopping area, also very close to restaurants, cafÃ© shops, fast food and souvenir shops. For being so close to the centre there is a price to pay. The Hotel is in a busy area and it is quiet noisy until early hours of the morning. Amsterdam is a busy place at all the time, so if you are looking for restful break Amsterdam isnâ€™t the place, you will be better of going to Rotterdam for that purpose. I highly recommend this Hotel to young people and couples as myself and my husband, also to all other people from different age brackets who are looking for adventure and want to see Amsterdam in its real charm .

Reviews.Title: “our money was stolen from the safe in reception (not a first!!!)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a stag party, we stayed in this hotel as it was in the heart of Amsterdam and although the found the hotel was scruffy, quite dirty and had basic amenities (well a portable tv in the room with no remote or any way to change the channel or higher or lower it and a broken shower) this was sufficent. We found the staff to be arrogant, extremely unhelpful and they seemed to disappear everytime there was a problem. Firstly they overcharged us, we argued about this, however eventually accepted and paid up. They then charged us 5 euros each to put our valuables, money and passports in their safety deposit boxes behind the counter in reception, which did not seem to be unreasonable. They were very anxious for us to use the safety deposit boxes and it soon became apparent why. When we went to check out of the hotel and take the valuables out of the boxes the passports were there but no money. The receptionist did not seem to be suprised and when I asked to see the CCTV footage, suprise, surprise there were no cameras on the safety deposit boxes, although they were everywhere else in the building and outside. After wasting two hours of our last day the owners son turned up at the hotel and went through the footage in a downstairs room with only one of our party (on fast forward). The owners son then offered to pay part of the money back but I said we were going to the police, the receptionist who was working when the money went missing said he would follow us to the police station. We made our report with the police and surprise, suprise he never showed up at the police station, so we went back to the hotel. He had apparently gone home and was no due back in until after 7pm even though he usually starts work at 4pm. Luckily enough we were not travelling home until late on so we told them we would be back. After getting the police report and going back to the hotel after 7, we showed the report to the receptionist and gave them a copy for their records. The receptionist denied he was going to follow us to the police station and blamed everybody apart from himself. At this point every other member of staff and all the dodgy characters who stood outside all day had disappeared. The police were also not surprised when we mentioned the name of the hotel. We never got to the bottom of the missing money although only one person had access to the keys to the safety deposit boxes throughout the time the money went missing. We had wasted a full day of my stag weekend and were left with no money to buy presents for the families / food & drink for ourselves or to enjoy all the attractions of one of the best cities in the world. I would strongly urged people to stay away from this hotel and all the dodgy characters who staff it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a few days break in Amsterdam, it is the fifth time of spending a long weekend there, usually we would stay in the botel but it was fully booked. We were a bit disapointed not being able to return to the same hotel but when we arrived at the koopermoolen disapointment turned to horor. It is really dark and dirty with no real maid service. There is a terrible stale smell everywhere you go. It is ideally situated in Amsterdam for the bars in the red light but if your going to Amsterdam to enjoy the culture i wouldn't stay here because you will be highly dissapointed. There are plenty of other hotels in this price range with far better facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Please do not stay here the hotel is run by thieves”
Reviews.Author: stubLiverpool
Reviews.Content: This is a dirty horrible hotel with small badly lit rooms that are not value for money, when we stayed not only did we experiaence the dirtyest hotel that weve ever stayed in we also experienced thieves working behind the reception. We purchased the rent of a safety deposit box and the money was stolen out of it which is a first for us, and we are a croud of ten lads from liverpool so nothing would usually shock us but this was beyond belief. So if you are reading this and have already booked a roon cancel it because for the money you pay you could get a hotel 100% better than this rat infested flee pit.

Reviews.Title: “All down to luck”
Reviews.Author: Quagland
Reviews.Content: To be honest before I booked my hotel I read reviews of many amsterdam hotels on this site and I decided to go with Hotel de Koopermoolen. After staying there I can honestly understand why so many people think its not up to standard. I was one of the lucky ones but its definitely not three star standard. I stayed there for five nites with my girlfriend. The room was ok although it looked nothing like the double room picture advertised on the site. First of all I'll comment on the staff..One of them was very helpful and friendly. The others came across as slightly arrogant. Not very helpful. Always sitting around in the lobbey smoking pot (its amsterdam..what do you expect i guess)..still..its not something u would expect to see in a hotel lobbey..the dont help you with your bags and the lift is tiny (about 1 square metre)..if you have a lot of luggage ur screwed.. When we eventually got to the room we thought "its not bad..could have been worse"..from the horror stories i had read about some hotel rooms in amsterdam this seemed ok..dont get me wrong..you get what you pay for..its one of the cheaper hotels so dont expect amazing rooms.we paid 370 euro for a double room for five nights. i think we were lucky enough to get one of the better rooms..i think if you have a room pre-booked you probably get the better ones. the only complaints i have about the room were the shower handle was broken which meant u had to hold it while showering(not too serious), the noise at night was terrible but thats what you get when you book a hotel in central amsterdam... the room was small but besides that it was just ok..i would give the room a three out of five.. the heating was working..the blankets were very light which didnt suit my girlfriend..she likes the heat..the tv worked..it is advertised that you can purchase movies to watch in your room..however when we asked at the desk they said the system was down..they seemed to find it very funny.. There was no telephone.. You can smoke in the room which is convenient. The bedside light worked..Aside from the shower the bathroom was fine.. it is very close to everything..very close to all the coffeeshops and red light district..and central station is only a 5/10 minute walk away.. Basically I agree with the other reviews..I can see why people were unhappy with the rooms. We were lucky to get a room with only minor things wrong with it.. Again, as the other guys said, if you are looking for a nice hotel DO NOT STAY HERE..if you are in a stag or hen party or just need a place to sleep for a few hours a night its fine.. i dont think we would stay there again though..

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Over priced. Dont stay here unless u dont care where u stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently toured europe and we had a stop in amsterdam. We booked at the this hotel called Hotel Central Amsterdam. Upon arriving there we found a boarded up building on the main strip with directions to another hotel. This place looked like it was condemned. So we walked over a couple of blocks to Hotel Koopermoolen. Which in comparison to the prevois hotel looked alright. Well we judged by the lobby appearnce. We were offered a chioce of room a larger room with its own bathroom which we had requested which was besdie the lobby and another tiny room at the back of the hotel. We chose the larger one with the bathroom. So for starters the TV didnt work. The Sheets were ripped. the toilet seat wouldnt stay up so it was constantly hittin u in the back or u had to hold it up while using the toilet. The bed side lights would work unless u balanced an ashtray on the cord. When we complained about the TV the said they would look at it. I later heard the staff laughing about the lack of TV. the knew it didnt work are werent goin to do anything about it. They were friendly people but there was always a couple of them hanging around the lobby watching TV and smokin pot. The location was great if u want drugged up people wandering past at all hours. We were moved upstairs to another room for the last night of our stay were there was no lift. have fun with your luggage no one offered to help. The room was tiny smelled bad and had no bathroom only a shower. We paid over 300 euros for this 3 night stay. I realize the staff and management probably dont care much as there will always be suckers lookin for a place to stay and that is why they make u pay up front. We looked for other hotels nearby whih were comparably priced and there are many other options. DO NOT STAY HERE! Unless u want your stay in amsterdam to be ruined. On a side note if are in college and just want a place to crash at the end of a night of bong hits and booze. this place would be ideal. If u want somewhere nice to stay with clean linens, etc. Dont stay here!

Reviews.Title: “great- hotel de koopermoolen”
Reviews.Author: nicky-sn
Reviews.Content: we are 2 couples from the uk and we have just recently returned from a stay at hotel de koopermoolen. we stayed over new year and it was superb! the hotel is great. it has nice clean rooms with everything you need in them, tv, shower gel shampoo and clean towels daily. the heating is on 24/7. which was great as it was snowing outside, you could turn the heating down or off if it got too warm. the breakfast is very good, eat as much as you like and is included in the room price. the staff are friendly and helpful. the location is brilliant right in the centre were you want to be and only 5 mins walk to central station. we will definitely stay here again. i would recommend this hotel to everyone. but remember this is a 3* hotel and is great value for a hotel right in the centre. but if you want 5* luxury you will have to pay much more!

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Web site !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Web site gives the impression of a quaint traditional hotel so we could not wait to check in. How wrong and different was the real thing. Our congratulations go to the photographer! The first room we were shown was above the front doors and the window at floor level gave the impression that this was a brothel (to the people out in the street!) The room was unbearably hot and tiny. Our second room on the top floor was quieter and cooler at the back of the hotel with a view of the rooftops. Access was by an ancient and very slow lift. Housekeeping was rubbish as all they did was tuck in the covers over the creased sheets etc. On the second day we discovered that the sheets were torn and complained - given clean sheets but had to remake beds ourselves - now understand why this hotel makes you pay in full up front! On the plus side, breakfast was quite acceptable, (but in a room more like a university refrectory)and the location is central, albeit very close to red light district.

Reviews.Title: “not to good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: our first night we had a room with a view to a back alley that had a really bad smell.we then were moved room the next day to a bigger room but the windows didnt open and the room was rather hot.breakfast was great location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “OK but won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on our honeymoon and Amsterdam was the last stop on our European vacation. The room was ok but the noise from outside was unbearable. It never stopped!! We couldn't sleep day or night. We liked the breakfast and the staff was nice, but the location for this hotel is a nightmare. It was also very hot in the room (we were there in March) and the window would not stay up. I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from Amsterdam having spent the w/e with my boyfriend and another couple. Firstly I had booked large double rooms with 'Kingsize beds' (internet description!). When we arrived, our friends were given a room with no window!! Bathroom was absolutely tiny and 2 of the lights were broken in the room! When we were shown our room, it had 2 single beds, with cigarrette burns all over the quilt covers! The noise was unbelievable from the street. Now don't get me wrong, we never had any intention of spending any time in the hotel - only to sleep, but u couldn't even do that. My friends were told they would get to change rooms the 2nd night, because it was soo stuffy what with no windows n all, they had just gotten engaged, so the hotel staff said they were being transferred to the nicest room they had - wait for it - another 2 single beds! Staff were ok to be fair, but the hotel is a glorified hostel. However, it is slap bang in the middle of things so for that, it cannot be faulted. But should I ever return to Amsterdam, I would definitely find somewhere a lot cleaner and nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Dont book the Single room.”
Reviews.Author: geoffboxer
Reviews.Content: On one of my frequent trips, I called at the reception to get info for a possible stay in a few months time. The girl was most helpful, gave me a price which although not the cheapest was about right. Told me I would get a nice sized single room with all the facilities.It seemed to be fine. I later contacted the hotel and booked, giving my credit card as guarentee, but paid no deposite. On arrival I was asked to pay for my 7 nights stay at reception. Told the man I needed to see the room first. Then my suspicions were arroused ! I was told to take the lift to the 4th floor, walk to my right as far as I could, up another flight of stairs and it was the last room on the right. The lift by the way was more like an upright coffin ! When I saw the tiny atic room my spirits dropped even further. Im 6ft 2in and I could not get into the the apology for a shower and toilet.The very small bed took up all the floor space. Told the man this was unaceptable.He said it was their only single room so I told him to keep it ! To be fair he did not take anything from my credit card.

Reviews.Title: “not worth staying even for free”
Reviews.Author: mb_travelgoddess
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel exhausted from travelling and was shown a room that was not acceptable. The next 2 rooms I saw were even less acceptable, including missing glass from a window pane. I was told the manager was not available and decided I would wait and talk to him the next day. I met with the owner's son and despite my dissatisfaction refused to return my advance payment so I could check out. I found the staff indifferent at best, their favorite response was, "talk to the manager". After 2 nights, I left and filed a complaint with the tourist board. Anyone who could have found anything good about this hotel would have to have been drunk their entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Koopermoolen brilliant !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the last weekend in April with a group of lads on a stag weekend. The hotel was excellent, the staff were all freindly and helpful - also good for a laugh. The hotel was VERY clean and tidy. I never made breakfast once but others in the group said there was plenty of it - continental style. I read in some other reviews about the area feeling unsafe (different hotels in the same street). Behind the hotel is the red light district the front street leads to DAM square about 5 mins walk. Our group did not see any problems in the 3 days we stayed there so do not be put off - I'd say its feels a lot safer than London. Its not the Hilton but I would say better value for money (only â‚¬55/night/person). Whether you are a group or couple on a low budget wanting a clean freindly hotel in the centre of Amsterdam then this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “basic but ideally located for old amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Koopermoolen for 3 nights 13 - 16 April 2004. We thought it was OK maybe a little basic but ideally located to live in the middle of the old part of the city. Further along the same road are a number of coffee shops where the customers clearly weren't just sharing expressos and a number of sex shops and gay clubs but they're all aspects of Amsterdam.This part of the city also has some wonderful restaurants, cosy little bars ( brown cafe's) and quaint side streets along the canals which all add up to a unique atmosphere where we felt entirely safe day and night. The hotel is a typical old local house. Our room was on the front at third floor level. It was triangular in shape with three windows ( that couldn't be openened) facing the main street so there was some noise at nights until the early morning. We had a comfortable bed, ensuite shower, wash basin and loo. Everything was reasonably clean, not spotless and not luxurious. Reception could do with brightening up, but the staff were friendly and helpful. The lift was useful as the stairs are extremely steep and winding. The only other facilities were the breakfast restaurant in the basement. This was a buffet of ham, cheese, egg, sliced breads, cereal, yoghurt, fruit juice and a choice of hot drinks - all fresh, as much as you liked and included in the price of the room. We thought overall it was good value, had real characterand was located ideally for seeing old Amsterdam on foot and by boat. The other guests were mainly young families, students or couples.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel De Koopermoolen
HotelInfo.Address: Warmoesstraat 5, Amsterdam 1012 HT , The Netherlands
